title: Challenges and Objectives of Project SimpleFleet
segmentation: I'm heutigen even from German aerospace Center or DLR and I'm going to give you a brief overview over the about the objectives.
Objectives and challenges of our newly project called Simple Fleet.
First, I'd like to give a brief overview.
With regard to the consultant, we are the coordinator, German Aerospace Center or DLR and the other partners are Athena Research Institute in Athens, Greece.
Vicki, you kiss in Austria.
It's a company dealing with geoinformatics stuff.
I will add a few words about this later on and lost partners talent.
Also, Creek partner.
It's a company dealing with.
Kind of fleet management software and other topics.
We will see that.
Yeah I have a slight purple.
But I will do this very quick as only a short slot.
We are the Institute transportation systems.
We are located in Berlin.
DLR is consists of more than a dozen individual institutes.
We're the concentrator and the.
The topics are primary.
Competencies are the recording of traffic data.
The management of traffic data and we also have a simulation called Sumo.
Perhaps you know it so we are also concerned with simulation and prediction.
Is the second part.
Right now it's a Research Institute, and it's especially the Institute for the Management Information System, so called EMS.
They're dealing with data management.
Anjou informatics.
Video Kiss in Austria is a company's industrial partner.
They what they do is they collect.
Corperate data about population.
Oregon amount economic data.
Demographic data from various sources, and relate that to.
Business intelligence applications based on digital Maps.
Lost partners talent increase its company dealing in the 1st place with fleet management systems and other.
Web publishing systems.
Related to Geo marketing as well.
So this.
The consortium I'd like.
I'd now like to give you a brief overview of the idea of the project.
The first thing we start off is.
Raw June data tracking data.
So let's say XY data, not the points, and we have to relate them.
We get them from floating car data broker.
He kills that continuously report position, reports about movement, trajectory in space and time to our service.
And we have to relate these these data to the digital road map.
This is done by map matching.
You see it in the top left then.
We have of course a large framework to collect all these data from the various fleets we have.
We all store this in databases and we not only collect the data, of course, we also do something with the data on top of the data.
Examples are to compute current travel times of out of the data or do speed profiles.
So here's the dimension time coming in.
We have, for example 168 week hours hours of the week and we can calculate average speed travel speeds for every link of a digital road map and for every hour of the week.
So this would be one example and then on top of all that is it here.
Below we can build services with the data.
We can provide travel time Maps.
We can travel time assessment and we can also predict traffic and we can do online routing services.
So this is.
Maybe a first key messages key message of the project we want to provide services, not just data.
We have a mat collecting large amounts of floating car data and other data sources as well, but we also want to build services on top of that.
So here's some.
Basic architecture, I will not explain everything everything in detail but give a brief overview.
We have that large fleet store.
There will be several demo cities connected to it, such as Athens, Berlin.
We have a fleet of 4800 taxes.
Which function is proof vehicles in Berlin?
This will be our fleet Sortore data data store and we see several layers of APIs application interfaces based on this raw data.
We will provide SDK software development kits and APIs too interested companies.
Which is.
Target we target at a beach B market.
We want to target companies who have data who needs traffic information and so this is a win win situation.

We get data from them and they get services on top of the data of all connected fleets in return and after the project if they want to continue to service then of course we have to bring off some business model to make them pay for it.
OK, so it's data plus services and here's some pictures of application.
Which we think of.
We can we plan to do a phone iPhone app.
We have some reachability analyze or catchment area stuff that we can do.
On top of that and visualize and other more mplus stuff.
Alternative ways to visualize traffic.
So last two slides, just very brief.
I would like to remind you once again of the challenges of simple fleet we are facing this situation that the existing fleet management solutions are a complex and be too expensive.
So now there's where we're trip we drop in.
I want to do something which is much more simple and has a much more simpler setup.
And also we want to do online routing services which require live traffic data.
So here's our basic setup for the solution what we need.
Is good data and code algorithms and simple setup.
We aim to achieve this by aggregating large amounts of traffic data.
It's a total of around 12,000 vehicles in different cities.
Athens, Berlin and Vienna, which we are in hold of and will obtained traffic data from and we will provide fundamental algorithms for build up to services on the fleet.
Management companies will need.
We offer API's and fundamental algorithms, so this was the brief overview.
I'd like to thank you for your interest and your attend.
Thank you very much.
So how would you position yourself against or between social?
OK, yeah.
Yeah, first of all, stuff like maybe an example would be Google traffic is.
Difference between our approach and Google traffic would be that we are aiming at the closed user.
Groups are close to the groups, which is obviously not in their concept right now and.
Yeah, then.
We have also the idea of integrating.
I'd say 3 dimensions into approach.
One is time, the second is algorithms and deferred would be data and we try to integrate all these 3 dimensions, which I currently do not really see.
Is filled in any current approach, so I think we do in some aspects something new.
We want to provide APIs and data which the customers can use to build their own applications to integrate the traffic data into their own applications.
